sanskrit_verse: विषघ्नैरगदैश्चास्य सर्वद्रव्याणि योजयेत् । विषघ्नैरुदकैश्चास्य सर्वद्रव्याणि शोधयेत् विषघ्नानि च रत्नानि नियतो धारयेत्सदा ॥ ७.२१८॥
transliteration: viṣaghnaire gadaiś cāsy sarvadravyāṇi yojayet | viṣaghnair udakaiś cāsy sarvadravyāṇi śodhayet viṣaghnāni ca ratnāni niyato dhārayetsadā || 7.218||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must apply antidotes and purifying substances to neutralize all toxic influences; one must cleanse all material resources through purificatory waters and maintain a constant discipline of holding sacred gems that counteract poison.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the knowledge and application of consciousness-aligned purification methods
Causation is traced to the presence or absence of protective spiritual disciplines
Capacity-based responsibility requires mastery over material and energetic environments
Restoration logic mandates reversal of contamination at source-consciousness level
Consciousness alignment necessitates sustained engagement with purificatory symbols and elements
executable_legal_axioms: IF contamination is detected in any resource THEN deploy viṣaghna agents immediately
IF purity levels fall below threshold THEN initiate śodhana protocol via udaka-based cleansing
IF individual holds viṣaghna ratnāni consistently THEN grant immunity from environmental toxicity liability
IF contamination spreads beyond containment THEN invoke collective dhāraṇa protocols
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that sovereign responsibility includes maintaining systemic immunity against spiritual-material contaminants. Liability arises not from intent but from failure to uphold continuous purification practices. Authority to judge rests on demonstrable capacity to restore purity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that impurity manifests sequentially due to neglect of viṣaghna discipline. Responsibility aligns with capacity to sustain śodhana processes. No punitive action occurs; correction follows natural consequence when purity protocols are reinstated. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures proportional restoration based on causal depth.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate compulsory śodhana immersion for contaminated entities until baseline purity restored
Assign viṣaghna ratna-bearing guardians to oversee high-risk zones
Implement daily dhāraṇa compliance audits for individuals handling public resources
Establish viṣaghna laboratories for real-time monitoring and neutralization of harmful energies
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as the Source of Dharma. This law restores balance through purification, not punishment. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth. Dharma prevails.
